screenings.Synopsis: In an alternate present-day version of Oakland, telemarketer Cassius Green discovers a magical key to professional success, propelling him into a macabre universe.
screenings.Credits: Starring Lakeith Stanfield, Tessa Thompson and Armie Hammer. Produced by Nina Yang Bongiovi, Kelly Williams, Jonathan Duffy, Charles D. King, George Rush and Forest Whitaker. Written by Boots Riley. Directed by Boots Riley.
screenings.Venue_Address: Enter at 11 West 53rd St. between 5th and 6th Avenues

screenings.Film_Title: MAMMA MIA: HERE WE GO AGAIN!
screenings.Synopsis: In this sequel to Mamma Mia!, a pregnant Sophie learns about her mother’s past.
screenings.Credits: Starring Christine Baranski, Pierce Brosnan, Dominic Cooper, Colin Firth, Andy Garcia, Lily James, Amanda Seyfried, Stellan Skarsgård, Julie Walters, Cher and Meryl Streep. Produced by Judy Craymer and Gary Goetzman. Story by Richard Curtis and Ol Parker and Catherine Johnson. Screenplay by Ol Parker. Directed by Ol Parker.
screenings.Venue_Address: Enter at 11 West 53rd St. between 5th and 6th Avenues

screenings.Synopsis: Using never-before-seen archival footage, exclusive demo recordings, rare performances, audio archives and original interviews with the people who knew her best, this documentary unravels the mystery behind Whitney Houston, who thrilled millions even as she struggled to make peace with her own troubled past.
screenings.Credits: Starring Whitney Houston, Bobby Brown, Cissy Houston and Clive Davis. Produced by Simon Chinn, Jonathan Chinn and Lisa Erspamer. Directed by Kevin Macdonald.

screenings.Synopsis: Thirteen-year-old Kayla endures the tidal wave of contemporary suburban adolescence as she makes her way through the last week of middle school—the end of her thus far disastrous eighth grade year—before she begins high school.
screenings.Credits: Starring Elsie Fisher, Josh Hamilton and Emily Robinson. Produced by Eli Bush, Scott Rudin, Christopher Storer and Lila Yacoub. Written by Bo Burnham. Directed by Bo Burnham.
screenings.Venue_Address: Enter at 11 West 53rd St. between 5th and 6th Avenues

screenings.Synopsis: Ethan Hunt and his IMF team join with some familiar allies in a race against time after a mission gone wrong.
screenings.Credits: Starring Tom Cruise, Henry Cavill, Ving Rhames, Simon Pegg, Rebecca Ferguson and Alec Baldwin. Produced by Tom Cruise, Christopher McQuarrie, Jake Myers, J.J. Abrams, David Ellison, Dana Goldberg and Don Granger. Written by Christopher McQuarrie. Directed by Christopher McQuarrie.
screenings.Venue_Address: Enter at 11 West 53rd St. between 5th and 6th Avenues

screenings.Synopsis: A story about the intersection of race and class, set against the backdrop of a rapidly gentrifying Oakland.
screenings.Credits: Starring Daveed Diggs, Rafael Casal and Janina Gavankar. Produced by Keith Calder, Jess Calder, Rafael Casal and Daveed Diggs. Screenplay by Rafael Casal & Daveed Diggs. Directed by Carlos López Estrada.

screenings.Synopsis: A wife questions her life choices as she travels with her husband to Stockholm, where he is slated to receive the Nobel Prize for Literature.
screenings.Credits: Starring Glenn Close, Jonathan Pryce, Christian Slater, Elizabeth McGovern and Annie Starke. Produced by Claudia Bluemhuber, Peter Gustafsson, Rosalie Swedlin, Meta Louise Foldager and Piers Tempest. Screenplay by Jane Anderson. Based on the book by Meg Wolitzer. Directed by Björn Runge.

misc.Description:
New York Membership Screenings take place at The Museum of Modern Art located at 11 West 53rd St. in Midtown.

For screenings in the Celeste Bartos Theater, please enter at The Lewis B. and Dorothy Cullman Education and Research Center entrance at 4 West 54th St. between 5th and 6th Avenues.

For screenings in the Roy and Niuta Titus Theaters 1 or 2, please enter via the MoMA Film entrance at 11 West 53rd St. between 5th and 6th Avenues. The entrance is located under the canopy near 5th Avenue.

Academy Members may bring one guest to screenings.

THERE ARE NO ADDITIONAL MEMBER SCREENINGS FOR THE MONTH OF AUGUST.
